title: Understanding Anxious Attachment
text: Anxious attachment is one of the types of insecure attachment styles. It often involves a strong desire for closeness and intimacy.

title: Characteristics of Anxious Attachment
text: Individuals with anxious attachment may experience a persistent fear of rejection or abandonment, even when in close relationships.

hintAnswer: a type of insecure attachment characterized by a need for closeness and intimacy but with a persistent fear of rejection or abandonment
title: Identifying Anxious Attachment
text: Which of the following best describes anxious attachment?
choices: a type of insecure attachment characterized by a need for closeness and intimacy but with a persistent fear of rejection or abandonment
a type of insecure attachment characterized by inconsistent or unpredictable behavior in caregivers, leading to confusion and fear in children
a type of insecure attachment characterized by a need for independence and discomfort with intimacy and closeness
The presence of two or more distinct personality states, with a disconnection in the individual’s sense of self and actions
